name: Antimicrobial Resistance Taskforce
mandate: Coordinates activities related to antimicrobial resistance and antimicrobial use across sectors. Develops policies and strategies to combat AMR, implements surveillance programs, and supports the Pan-Canadian Framework for Action against AMR through One Health approaches.

name: Centre for Emergency Response
mandate: Manages emergency response activities including natural disasters such as floods, fires, and hurricanes. Coordinates public health emergency response, provides operational support during disasters, and ensures continuity of essential health services during emergency situations.

name: Risk Assessment Hub
mandate: Conducts rapid risk assessments for unassigned signals and diseases with unknown pathogens. Evaluates emerging health threats, provides initial risk characterization for novel or unidentified disease agents, and supports decision-making for public health response to unknown health hazards.

name: Centre for Communicable Diseases and Infection Control - Infection Prevention and Surveillance Division
mandate: Conducts surveillance and prevention activities for tuberculosis, nosocomial pathogens including C. auris, antimicrobial resistant pathogens through CNISP, and infection prevention and control (IPC) programs. Monitors healthcare-associated infections and provides guidance on infection control measures.

name: Centre for Communicable Diseases and Infection Control - Sexually Transmitted and Blood-Borne Infections
mandate: Conducts surveillance, prevention, and control activities for sexually transmitted and blood-borne infections including HIV, AIDS, Hepatitis B and C, gonorrhea, chlamydia, syphilis, and mpox. Develops clinical guidelines and coordinates national STBBI surveillance networks.

name: Centre for Foodborne, Environmental and Zoonotic Infectious Diseases - Foodborne, Waterborne Disease and Enteric Antimicrobial Resistance Surveillance
mandate: Conducts surveillance of foodborne and waterborne diseases including bacterial, viral, and parasitic pathogens. Monitors antimicrobial use and resistance in humans, animals, and food systems. Investigates avian influenza cases related to food vehicles such as milk and ground beef products.

name: Centre for Foodborne, Environmental and Zoonotic Infectious Diseases - Outbreak Management Division
mandate: Manages outbreaks of enteric and foodborne diseases including amoebiasis, botulism, campylobacteriosis, cholera, cryptosporidiosis, cyclosporiasis, giardiasis, hepatitis A, listeriosis, norovirus, salmonellosis, shigellosis, paratyphoid and typhoid fever, paralytic shellfish poisoning, VTEC, yersiniosis, vibrio, and hepatitis of unknown etiology.

name: Centre for Foodborne, Environmental and Zoonotic Infectious Diseases - Zoonoses Division
mandate: Conducts surveillance and response for zoonotic and vector-borne diseases including anthrax, brucellosis, hantavirus, Lyme disease, malaria, plague, rabies, tularemia, West Nile virus, yellow fever, anaplasmosis, Zika, dengue, Lassa fever, animal/avian influenza, and chikungunya.

name: Centre for Emergency Response and Infectious Pathogen Preparedness - Response and Issues Management
mandate: Manages response to infectious respiratory illnesses (influenza, RSV, COVID-19, adenovirus, MERS-CoV, swine influenza, avian influenza, EV-D68, Legionellosis), vaccine preventable diseases (AFP, chickenpox, congenital rubella, diphtheria, invasive group A strep, Group B strep in newborns, H. influenzae, measles, invasive meningococcal disease, mumps, pertussis, invasive pneumococcal disease, polio, rubella, tetanus), viral hemorrhagic fevers (Ebola, Marburg, Sudan virus), post-COVID conditions, and long COVID.

name: Post COVID-19 condition surveillance program
mandate: Conducts surveillance of Post COVID-19 condition.

name: Centre for Emergency Response and Infectious Pathogen Preparedness - Respiratory Virus Surveillance
mandate: Conducts surveillance of infectious respiratory illnesses including influenza, RSV, adenovirus, MERS-CoV, swine influenza, avian influenza, EV-D68, Legionellosis, and respiratory diseases of unknown pathogen. Monitors COVID-19 epidemiology, variants of concern, and coordinates integrated respiratory virus surveillance systems.

name: National Advisory Committee on Immunization
mandate: Provides expert advice on all aspects of immunization and vaccines (passive and active immunizing agents) affecting Canada. Reviews vaccine safety and efficacy data, develops immunization recommendations, and provides guidance on vaccine use for various populations and circumstances.

name: National Microbiology Laboratory
mandate: Provides laboratory services and research for all pathogens including bacterial, viral, fungal, and agents of unknown origin. Conducts diagnostic testing, strain characterization, antimicrobial resistance testing, and serves as Canada's reference laboratory for infectious disease identification and confirmation.

name: Substance-Related Harms Division
mandate: Conducts surveillance and response activities for substance-related acute toxicity (overdoses) and monitors trends in opioids, stimulants, benzodiazepines, hallucinogens, cannabis, alcohol, and tobacco use. Coordinates national surveillance of drug-related deaths and hospitalizations.

name: Centre for Border and Travel Health - Policy, Programs, and Travel Health
mandate: Monitors and assesses issues or events outside of Canada that may impact the health of Canadian travelers. Provides travel health recommendations, issues travel health notices, and coordinates border health screening measures for international health threats.

name: Vaccination Coverage and Information Systems
mandate: Monitors vaccination coverage for all vaccines except tuberculosis. Maintains immunization registries, conducts coverage surveys, analyzes vaccination trends, and supports provincial/territorial immunization information systems to track vaccine uptake across Canada.

name: Vaccine Preventable Diseases
mandate: Conducts surveillance of vaccine preventable diseases including acute flaccid paralysis (AFP), chickenpox, congenital rubella, diphtheria, invasive group A streptococcal disease, Group B strep in newborns, Haemophilus influenzae, measles, invasive meningococcal disease, mumps, pertussis, invasive pneumococcal disease, polio, rubella, and tetanus.

name: Vaccine Safety Surveillance Program
mandate: Monitors adverse events following immunization (AEFI) and conducts vaccine safety surveillance activities. Investigates vaccine safety signals, maintains CAEFISS database, and provides evidence-based assessments of vaccine safety to support immunization programs.

name: Pandemic Vaccine Procurement Policy Program
mandate: Manages pandemic vaccine research and development initiatives and coordinates pandemic vaccine supply planning. Develops procurement strategies, maintains vaccine stockpiles, and ensures Canada's preparedness for vaccine needs during pandemic situations.

name: Vaccine Effectiveness and Post-market Surveillance
mandate: Evaluates vaccine effectiveness and monitors vaccine coverage in Canada. Conducts post-market surveillance studies, analyzes real-world vaccine performance, and provides evidence on vaccine impact to support immunization policy decisions.

name: Global Public Health Intelligence Network
mandate: Monitors and assesses chemical, biological, radiological, and nuclear (CBRN) events globally. Provides early warning intelligence on potential health threats through automated surveillance of international media and official reports to support global health security.
